com.aloqa.trax.client.saps
Interface App_SAP_App

public interface App_SAP_App

Implement this interface in order to receive and respond to push-notifications from an application running either at the server side or at another mobile device. For each SingleTargetNotificationRequest in an NotificationRequest issued by the remote notifier application, the corresponding mobile target is called back via this interface. The result message of handlePushMessageDoAck(byte[]) is then carried back to the remote notifier application by means of a corresponding SingleTargetNotificationResponse. For example, by using NotificationRequests / NotificationResponses via the TraXAPI_SAP_App interface and by implementing this interface, a chat application that passes push messages between mobile devices can be implemented in no time. Another example is push from the server in order to deliver coupons or other information to mobile devices in a proactive fashion.

Method Summary
 byte[] handlePushMessageDoAck(byte[] msg)
          Delivers a push message from a remote application to this mobile target and delivers back the resulting acknowledge message to the remote application.
 void handlePushMessageNoAck(byte[] msg)
          Delivers a push message from a remote application to this mobile target and return NO acknowledgement.
 

Method Detail

handlePushMessageDoAck

byte[] handlePushMessageDoAck(byte[] msg)
Delivers a push message from a remote application to this mobile target and delivers back the resulting acknowledge message to the remote application. Do never block in this method (!!), e.g., in order to wait for user input. If user input needs to be sent in response to this invocation, then use separate NotificationRequests or try another communication protocol, e.g. http for uploading data to your application server. If this method blocks (more than 1 second) it is very likely that the result message will be discarded by the Aloqa server and that the status of the message will be NOT DELIVERED.

Parameters:
msg - The push message coming from the remote application.
Returns:
A byte array holding the response message that will be delivered to the remote application.

handlePushMessageNoAck

void handlePushMessageNoAck(byte[] msg)
Delivers a push message from a remote application to this mobile target and return NO acknowledgement. Do never block in this method (!!), e.g., in order to wait for user input.

Parameters:
msg - The push message coming from the remote application.
